docs.snippet: Another Alabama school was on lockdown after a social media post warned of clowns showing up to the campus.

headline.print_headline: Alabama School Locked Down After Threat of Clowns Showing Up
headline.main: Alabama School Locked Down After Threat of Clowns Showing Up

docs.snippet: Ballot selfies are legal in 18 states and the District of Columbia.
Move fast, break things, get back on the tour bus: The world’s tech capital is a tourist destination, too.

headline.main: Daily Report: China Dreams of Silicon Valley

docs.snippet: French officials say three men have been charged and jailed after a woman was allegedly lured on Facebook by one of them and then gang-raped near the Eiffel Tower.

headline.print_headline: Woman Allegedly Lured on FB and Gang-Raped Near Eiffel Tower
headline.main: Woman Allegedly Lured on FB and Gang-Raped Near Eiffel Tower

docs.snippet: The arrest was apparently the first under the country’s tough law against insulting the monarchy since King Maha Vajiralongkorn Bodindradebayavarangkun succeeded his father on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Thailand Arrests Student Accused of Sharing Article
headline.main: Thailand Arrests Student Accused of Sharing Article About New King

docs.snippet: Police in Missoula have cited a 15-year-old boy with disorderly conduct after a clown threat was posted on social media.

headline.print_headline: Montana Police Cite Student Over Clown Threat Statement
headline.main: Montana Police Cite Student Over Clown Threat Statement

docs.snippet: A computer science student in a former Soviet republic found there was money to be made in mixing real and made-up stories, as long as they were pro-Trump.

headline.print_headline: Websites Hit a ‘Gold Mine’ in Fake News
headline.main: Inside a Fake News Sausage Factory: ‘This Is All About Income’

docs.abstract: Websites run by student Beqa Latsabidze of Georgian Republic and Canadian satirist John Egan offer insight into ecosystem of fake news, on Internet and social media, which Pres Obama has warned may be corrosive threat; sites were started without any partisan goal, yet they proved to be extremely lucrative for their owners during 2016 presidential election.

docs.snippet: Justice Minister Heiko Maas said on Monday the German government could take legal action against Facebook and other social media groups if they do not intensify their fight against illegal hate speech or Islamist "terror phantasies".

headline.print_headline: German Minister Sets March Deadline for Fight Against Online Hate
headline.main: German Minister Sets March Deadline for Fight Against Online Hate

docs.snippet: In the wake of King Bhumibol Adulyadej's death, Thais are expressing their grief in black and white.

headline.print_headline: In Wake of Thai King's Death, Grief Is Black and White
headline.main: In Wake of Thai King's Death, Grief Is Black and White
